question.title: Excel Column number
question.content:
You have been given a column title as appears in an Excel sheet, return its corresponding column number.

For example:
A -> 1
B -> 2
C -> 3
...
Z -> 26
AA -> 27
AB -> 28 
...
Input Format
The only line of input contains a string S i.e. column title
Constraints:
1 <= |S| <= 10
Input contains only uppercase English Alphabet letters

Time Limit : 1 sec
Output Format
The only line of output will print the column number corresponding to given column title
Sample Input 1
AB
Sample Output 1
28
Sample Input 2
ZZZ
Sample Output 2
18278

rephrased.body: Given a column title as it appears in an Excel sheet, determine its corresponding column number. The column titles follow a base-26 numbering system where 'A' represents 1, 'B' represents 2, ..., 'Z' represents 26, 'AA' represents 27, 'AB' represents 28, and so on.
constraints: Input contains only uppercase English Alphabet letters

testcases.explanation: The column title 'AB' corresponds to the column number 28. This is because 'A' represents 1 and 'B' represents 2.  So (1 * 26^1) + (2 * 26^0) = 26 + 2 = 28.
The column title 'ZZZ' corresponds to the column number 18278. This is because 'Z' represents 26. So (26 * 26^2) + (26 * 26^1) + (26 * 26^0) = (26 * 676) + (26 * 26) + 26 = 17576 + 676 + 26 = 18278.

hints: Think of the question as converting a binary number into decimal form.
